Articles.Content:
As a moderator, I have helped out a little with testing the game before releases, and so I know how busy these guys are, how hard they work, and how many problems they find and fix. Yes, yes, I know blaming a game's QA system is one of those internet things everyone does, like complaining about certain bands, and hating certain kinds of clothes. But remember that these are good people, many of the testers are unpaid volunteers, and they do a technical and frequently tedious job of discovering problems, tracing the sources, and reporting them to do the devs, for the sake of making the game we all like better. And they do get to feeling sad and discouraged when they get hit with so much blame and negativity. So I would like to take a moment to thank them for their efforts on our behalf, and I invite others to do so as well. 

Thank you, QA/testing teams!

Agreed, thank you to everyone involved in making KSP even better!!!

Emiko Kerman loves all of you!!!!
Thanks QA guys. I can't say I enjoy career mode but the rest of the game is relatively bug-free. And by "relatively" I mean I haven't actually encountered any severe bugs in 1.2. Job well done.

Absolutely... I simply cannot say anything without repeating what has already been said. The QA that was put in place after the fiasco of 1.0 worked extremely well and the end result was a highly polished product. Thanks to all who helped!

Yes indeed, I second this. QA testing is a task that often misunderstood and so it's easy to point blame at it and wonder how this mystical process somehow managed to miss an "obvious" bug. But it's really hard and extremely tedious and the way the game is currently performing is really testament to the team doing a great job.
So yes, Thanks QA team!!

Absolutely, the QA and testing guys and gals often get passed over for praise when things go well.

They are the indispensable 'roadies' for the 'rock star' devs.

Indeed, what these guys do is highly underrated and easily over looked or demeaned for missing things.

Thank you QA team for many years of helping this amazing game  !
